intro: Macroscepis obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate macrocephalus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and purple. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
